label: 通庭
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: Dirt-floored passage...running along one side from front to back.  The tōriniwa not only served as a corridor, but had the same function as the doma in farmhouses.  Along one side were the cooking facilities and often a well and, a short distance from these, the privy (p. 670).  [土間]
